What Are Online Medicine Delivery Apps and How Do They Help You?

An Online Medicine Delivery App is a mobile app that lets you order medicines from your phone and get them delivered to your home. It’s helpful for people who are sick, elderly, or just too busy to visit a pharmacy.

Here’s how these apps help:

Easy Ordering: You can order prescriptions by uploading a picture or find over-the-counter medicines quickly.

Delivered to Your Door: Your medication comes right to your house, saving you a trip to the pharmacy. You can often track your order to see when it will arrive.

Save Time and Money: You save time not having to travel or wait in lines. Some apps also offer discounts or deals on your medicines.

Convenient and Private: It’s super convenient for busy people or if you can’t easily leave home. Your orders are also handled privately.

Safe and Trustworthy: Good medicine delivery apps work with real pharmacies and follow rules to make sure your drugs are safe and real.

As internet usage increases in India, the demand for online medicine delivery apps is also rising. These apps are convenient and save a lot of time. According to Statista, experts predict the market to reach US$81.37bn by 2028, indicating a huge potential for business in this field.

For business owners and entrepreneurs, it’s also a great idea to launch such an app. The demand is high, and many software solutions are available to get started fast and affordably. 

Must-Have Features of an Online Medicine Delivery App

Before choosing and diving deep into the details of top online medicine delivery apps, it’s better to know the must have features that the app should include. This way you have a clear idea of what you need and what you should expect from an app that you’re installing. 

As a user, the first thing that we should look for is reliability, ease of use and prompt delivery services. Now let’s get into the details of the features: 

Set location

If the customers can’t find their nearby stores and get the medicines on time, what’s the point of using a medicine delivery app? 

This feature helps customers to discover nearby pharmacies or medical stores based on the location they set. Also, this feature gives a personalized shopping experience, saving time. 

Multiple Payment Method

If as a customer you want to pay digitally and find no option for digital payment on the app would you still use it? Honestly, as a user, I won’t. 

Having multiple payment methods makes a business look trustworthy. An app with multiple payment methods will ensure that all the customers are served properly with a lower cart abandonment rate. 

Businesses always try to make sure their customers feel safe using the service while launching their medicine delivery app.  

Multiple languages

Not everyone is a multi-lingual person. In particular elderly people or senior citizens who need to buy medicine using an app might face difficulty due to a foreign language. Integrated multiple language systems in the app will give the users a personalized experience and help them navigate easily. 

Search and Filtration

Having an accurate in-app search option can elevate the user experience for a medicine delivery mobile app.

Suppose your grandfather needs a particular medicine, and you’re scrolling through thousands of options from the app to find the one you need. Wouldn’t it be frustrating? Instead of manual scrolling wouldn’t it be better to have a search option where you would just start typing, and the autocomplete would do its magic? 

Social Login

Do you remember all your passwords, or do you write them down somewhere just in case you forget? Isn’t it a hassle to keep the paper safe where you’ve written your password? This is why a social login system in an app can be incredibly helpful. With this system, you won’t have to worry about creating a new account from scratch or remembering passwords separately.

Wishlist

Picture this: You’re browsing a pharmacy app and come across an item that you might need in the future. But there’s no way to save it for later. Frustrating, right? That’s why having a “wishlist” feature is a good idea. With this feature, you can effortlessly save items you’re interested in and return them later. Mobile medicine developers use it to make their customers happy and encourage them to return to your app for future purchases.

Order Tracking

How long will you wait for your medicine to come to your doorstep? Forever? No!

Of course, it’s a customer’s right to know the order progress. The mobile application should have a live order tracking feature, updating users on the delivery status. 

Live Chat

Sometimes, customers order the wrong medicines or forget to add an important one to the cart before proceeding. Also, they might need to talk with the deliveryman for any delivery-related issues. For this reason, having a live chat option is essential for quick and convenient communication between customers and deliverymen or sellers. 

Wallet and Loyalty Points

As a loyal customer of a certain app, you should have some perks like a wallet and loyalty points option. This option will not only enhance your shopping experience but also will value your loyalty to the app (a user’s loyalty to the app.)

Notifications

If the app is running a campaign, exclusive deals, sales, or exciting offers, it should notify the users. This way the users will get medicine at a great deal and encourage their loyalty.

How to Build Your Own Online Medicine Delivery App?

After reading all the above information about online medicine apps, I’m sure now you know the potential of this industry and how the top existing apps are thriving in their business. If you’re someone who wants to build or launch the fastest medicine delivery app, you need to do careful consideration.

It’s not just a user-facing app. It requires an admin panel, a pharmacy store application and panel, and a deliveryman app.

Step 1:  Define your unique value proposition

In this step, outline your goals and unique offerings for your target customers in the healthcare market. 

Step 2: Market Analysis

Analysis and test the existing apps in the market to get a clear idea of where they are lacking and how you can fill up the void in the market. 

Step 3: Team Building

Building a successful application and system requires a dedicated and hard-working team. Below are the examples of team members that you need to build your own team for launching an online medicine delivery app – 

  • Project Manager
  • Frontend Developers
  • Backend Developers
  • UI/UX Designers

Step 4: Choosing the right technology stack

You’re not only just building or launching a mere app, but you’re also building an entire system to run the online delivery service smoothly through the app. For that reason, you need to choose the appropriate technology stack based on requirements.

Step 5: Develop a Prototype

A prototype will help you visualize the whole system before moving for the entire development process. In this stage, you will be able to change requirements and add new features if needed. 

Step 6: Development Phase

In this step, start developing your applications by dividing them into manageable sprints for iterative improvements. 

Step 7: Feature Integration

Integrate features like authentication, prescription upload, and multiple payment gateway for a seamless user experience from your mobile application. 

Step 8: Security and Compliance

When it comes to handling sensitive medical data, it is important to prioritize security and ensure that all healthcare regulations are being followed. This means implementing robust encryption protocols to safeguard against unauthorized access and conducting thorough security audits to identify any vulnerabilities. By taking these steps, you can help to ensure that patient data remains safe, secure, and protected at all times.

Step 9: Testing and Quality Assurance

For this step, your QA team will rigorously test the app, its functions, and its usability. If any issue comes up, they address it, and developers try to resolve it. 

Step 10: Ready for Launching 

After completing the whole development process, your app is ready to launch. In this step, try to get help from your marketing team to create a buzz about your app to your target audience.

FAQs

1. Which is the best online medicine app in India?

Apps like Tata 1mg, PharmEasy, Practo App, NetMeds, and Apollo 247 – Health & Medicine are some of the best medicine delivery apps in India.

2. What features are essential for an instant medicine delivery app?

An instant medicine delivery app must have a zone-wise business setup option, multiple payment methods, multiple languages, search & filtration options, social login, wishlist, order tracking etc, in the user app. 

3. How can I develop an online medicine delivery app?

To develop an online medicine delivery app ( build), you can either build a team from scratch or get a readymade solution like MarketKing to launch your app. 

4. How long does it typically take to develop and launch an online medicine delivery app?

It depends on the complexity and features of the app. From ideation to final launch, it may take several months and sometimes a year.

5. How do online medicine delivery apps work?

Most ePharmacy platforms let users upload prescriptions, choose medicines, and get them delivered at home. They often include pharmacist verification to ensure the right medication is dispatched and use cold chain logistics for temperature-sensitive drugs.

6. How much does pharmacy app development cost in India?

The pharmacy app development cost in India varies based on features like telemedicine, pincode-based delivery, subscription models, and real-time inventory sync. Basic apps may start around ₹10–30 lakhs, while advanced ones can go higher ( if you go for custom development). 

7. Are e-pharmacy apps safe for ordering prescription drugs?

Yes, most top digital health apps follow strict regulations. They require valid prescriptions, conduct pharmacist verification, and ensure proper healthcare delivery practices. Stick to reputable platforms for safe medicine ordering.

8. What should I check before using an online pharmacy?

Check for prescription upload support, licensed pharmacist verification, drug database accuracy, and whether they offer last-mile delivery in your area. Also, look for reviews and the reliability of the health tech startup behind the app.
